title.narrative: WASH IN SCHOOLS AND CLINICS

description.narrative: Sustained access to and use of water, sanitation and hygiene practices for all children and young people particularly the most disadvantaged and those living in humanitarian situations:, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children, adolescents and their families, especially the most vulnerable, have improved access to sustainable, equitable and safely managed water, sanitation and hygiene services including in most vulnerable communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sustained access to and use of water, sanitation and hygiene practices for all children and young people particularly the mostdisadvantaged and those living in humanitarian situations:

description.narrative: UNICEF provided 67 healthcare facilities with WASH services in Anbar, Baghdad, Basrah, Kirkuk, Najaf, Ninawa and Dohuk, ensuring continuity of health services for 210,000 people (47% ;children and 51% women/girls). UNICEF provided 193 primary and secondary schools with access to improved accessible and gender sensitive WASH facilities in Ninawa, Dohuk, Kirkuk, Anbar, Baghdad, and Najaf and developed a new design for child-friendly facilities for children with disabilities. Finally, UNICEF reached a total of 305,674 people (45% children and 51% women/girls) in Dohuk, Ninawa, Baghdad, Kirkuk and Erbil with WASH hygiene supplies and with social mobilization and civic engagement interventions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2022
